column3: Met Office MIDAS Open: UK Land Surface Stations Data
The authority is the latest organisation which owned the station
Closed stations without an authority listed have the authority set to NA
The midas_qc_version_number indicates if the data are original received message (0) or current best version (1)
missing values are identified with the missing data flag
Date and time at end of observation
Date and time (YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS) at the end of the observation period
Use ob_end_time in conjunction with ob_hour_count to determine the period over which the observation relates.
Common periods include 12 hour observations ending at 0900 or 2100 or 24 hour observations ending at 0900.
a station may have more than one id assigned to it defined by id_type
a station may have more than one id assigned to it
number of hours the observation period spans
The midas_qc_version_number indicates if the data are original received message (0) or current best version (1)
state indicator for the current stage in the life of the record (see MIDAS documentation)
maximum air temperature recorded during the observation period
minimum air temperature recorded during the observation period
minimum grass temperature recorded during the observation period
minimum concrete temperature recorded during the observation period
maximum air temperature qc code (see MIDAS documentation)
minimum air temperature qc code (see MIDAS documentation)
minimum grass temperature qc code (see MIDAS documentation)
minimum concrete temperature qc code (see MIDAS documentation)
maximum air temperature descriptor code (see MIDAS documentation)
minimum air temperature descriptor code (see MIDAS documentation)
minimum grass temperature descriptor code (see MIDAS documentation)
minimum concrete temperature descriptor code (see MIDAS documentation)
Met Office receipt stamp time as YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS
elapsed time to storage in MIDAS
elapsed time to storage in MIDAS in minutes
